image.altText: An overhead view of a surfer in the ocean.

props.synopsis: A quarter of a century since white sharks were declared vulnerable, scientists and surfers want to know whether steps to protect the predator along Australia's coasts are linked to a recent wave of attacks.

title.children: White sharks have been protected for 25 years â€” is that linked to recent attacks?

image.altText: Energy Minister Penny Sharpe

props.synopsis: While progress has been made restoring stability to Broken Hill's power supply after wild weather destroyed key infrastructure, the mayor says the community has been "let down".

title.children: Recovery assistance for NSW's far west to begin this week as mayor slams power delays

image.altText: Elderly couple smile, woman in green tee, short grey hair, looks at the man in blue check , stand under a tree, roses behind.

props.synopsis: With more than 450 varieties of roses, this couple has created a thriving oasis, which is considered one of the best open gardens in the Riverland Rose and Garden Festival.

title.children: For 26 years, Lorna and Brad's open garden has drawn admirers. Their love story blossomed even earlier

image.altText: Serious man, shaved head, tattoos on arms leans on boxing ring ropes, wears black tee with Scottie Williams, part man, wolf pic.

props.synopsis: Working as a bouncer in pubs and clubs around Australia, Scottie Williams is no stranger to breaking up scuffles, but he wanted more out of life.

title.children: By their 40s, most boxers have long since retired. So why is this man taking on a dangerous fight?

image.altText: Adelaide United assistant coach Travis Dodd and defender Bailey O'Neil

props.synopsis: The current A-League Men's competition has less than a handful of Indigenous players, but emerging talent Bailey O'Neil and mentor Travis Dodd want to "get that ball rolling" when it comes to improving pathways.

title.children: Bailey O'Neil is one of just three Indigenous players in the A-League Men â€” he hopes to inspire more

image.altText: a man in a business suit walks outside a court building

props.synopsis: A South Australian family says they forgive an Italian tourist whose "terrible error" caused a crash which killed three of their relatives in the state's Mid North last year, and say they do not believe he should be jailed.Â

title.children: Family forgives Italian tourist for 'serious lapse' which caused triple-fatal crash

image.altText: A woman with short blonde hair wearing a pink and tan dress leans on a marble kitchen bench smiling and looking off camera.

props.synopsis:
The cook was named Best Host of a TV Format Award at the C21 International Format Awards for the ABC show Maggie Beer's Big Mission, a project aiming to overhaul the aged care industry's dismal catering.Â 

Â

title.children: Maggie Beer wins international TV award, beating industry legends Jimmy Kimmel and Stephen Fry

image.altText: A close-up of a bald man wearing glasses, a navy blazer and white shirt.

props.synopsis: As Sanjeev Guptaâ€™s global empire lurches from one crisis to the next, the metals tycoon has told ABC News heâ€™s committed to returning Whyallaâ€™s steelworks to profitability, again promising a $1 billion transition to making green steel at the plant.

title.children: He's down a billion dollars, but the owner of Whyalla steelworks isnâ€™t giving up on the pursuit of profitability

image.altText: An image of a person driving with a dog on their lap while using their mobile phone.

props.synopsis: South Australian Police says at least 80 drivers could lose their licences after being caught illegally using a mobile phone four or more times behind the wheel.Â

title.children: Police say 80 drivers could lose their licences after being caught by detection cameras in one month

image.altText: Hainsworth interview

props.synopsis: Steven Hainsworth was arrested in 2019, 21 years after allegedly murdering the first of three victims. He has spent the past two months listening intently to evidence from the Supreme Court dock.

title.children: From arrest to trial, this is how the case of an accused serial killer unfolded

image.altText: Woman speaking into microphone outside parliament house.

props.synopsis: University of Adelaide law academic Joanna Howe has posted to social media labelling female politicians 'baby killers' following a failure to change South Australian abortion laws.

title.children: Anti-abortion activist brands female politicians 'baby killers' in social media post

image.altText: National Guard in riot gear with shields line up in front of the Capitol building at night

props.synopsis: American voters on both sides hate the feedback loop that is creating more polarisation with each election. So why is change so elusive?

title.children: For a country known for its patriotism, Americans really hate their own democracy

image.altText: A woman with a bandaged face and headdress is in the foreground of a dirty hospital room with people on the floor

props.synopsis: Israeli forces withdraw from a hospital complex in northern Gaza, with the Palestinian enclave's health ministry saying troops had detained dozens of male medical staffers and some patients.

title.children: Israeli army detains medics at northern Gaza hospital, according to health ministry

image.altText: Israeli flag and Iran flag seen together.

props.synopsis: This round of fighting between Israel and Iran might be over, but the rules have changed and things are increasingly dangerous.

title.children: Israel and Iran have stopped firing, but they have moved closer to all-out war

image.altText: Richard White rings bell at the Australian Stock Exchange in Sydney.

props.synopsis: WiseTech is not the only publicly-listed company to face allegations of bad behaviour. Big investors are now asking if corporate boards are doing enough to hold executives to account.Â

title.children: Boards investigate scandal-hit bosses but continue to stand by their man

image.altText: Hands on a black jacket with a NSW Police patch

props.synopsis: A former sergeant with the NSW Police has told the ABC about their experience of homophobia while serving, including hearing "extremely homophobic" remarks during Sydney WorldPride 2023.

title.children: 'He spat in my face': Former NSW Police sergeant alleges 'horrific' homophobia during career

image.altText: A man and woman hugging in front of a for sale sign at a house

props.synopsis: Each generation has had its own unique struggles with first-home ownership. But which has had it the worst? Experts say it has little to do with smashed avo.Â

title.children: Lazy millennials to lucky boomers: The generational struggles with first-home ownership

image.altText: Woman bending down in a field of vegetables growing

props.synopsis: Fresh produce goes to waste because it's too small, slightly yellow from sunburn or has tiny spots of leaf rub.

title.children: Food waste warriors stop tonnes of produce ending up in bins

image.altText: Nedd Brockmann lies on the ground and covers his head

props.synopsis: Nedd Brockmann's 1,600-km run has broken him down physically. But the 25-year-old former sparky said it has all been worth it.

title.children: 'How the hell did I do that?': The extraordinary toll of running 1,600km in 12-and-a-half days

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed and a serious look on his face. The Hard Quiz has been added behind his head

props.synopsis: I s'pose you think you're a bit alright at this trivia thing. Go ahead â€” try and impress me.

title.children: Talk a big Hard Quiz game? Time to prove how much you know

image.altText: Charles and Camilla smile as students behind them raise their arms in front of the Opera House's white sails

props.synopsis: A protest about Indigenous reparation, questions over a Republic and the Big C shadowed the King's 17th visit to Australia. But he gave it his all.

title.children: Republicans and monarchists were in the crowds clamouring to see the royal couple this week. One thing united them

image.altText: Antony Green and the ABC panel on Queensland election night 2024

props.synopsis: It was all supposed to be over quickly last night, but then somewhere in the last fortnight Queenslanders decided to change the script.

title.children: This Queensland election result definitely wasn't part of the plan and both sides of politics were in denial

image.altText: A woman stands outside her house and looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: Inadequate or missing essential services, including water and sewerage, are frustrating new homeowners and holding up the construction of thousands more dwellings in regional Victoria, say developers.

title.children: How a lack of simple water and sewerage pipes are stalling thousands of new homes in Victoria

image.altText: A creek with water flowing

props.synopsis: Personal trainer Jack McLennan disappeared on October 4 after a boy's trip to a campground in southern Queensland. Now, as a police search is scaled down, his family fears the worst.

title.children: This tranquil fishing spot has become the centre of 'something seriously bad'

image.altText: Two photos of two young girls overlap each other

props.synopsis: A family who waited 36 years for answers about the deaths of two Indigenous girls in Bourke, says it is "disgraceful" that police have disregarded a key recommendation from a recent inquest.

title.children: Families outraged by 'disgraceful' NSW police decision to ignore coroner's advice after girls' deaths

image.altText: New Zealand's captain Tom Latham along with his teammates celebrate after their win against India

props.synopsis: India's proud streak of not losing a home test series since 2012 came to an abrupt end on Saturday in a humiliating 2-0 defeat by New Zealand

title.children: New Zealand spin their way to famous series win in India, England crumble to Pakistan

image.altText: A picture of a finished sweet potato dhal dish

props.synopsis: This dhal recipe is a secret weapon for two reasons.

title.children: Spice-filled sweet potato dhal

image.altText: Ty stands on a soccer pitch with soccer goal in the distance

props.synopsis: People often avoid the topics of death and cancer around Ty, but he doesn't ask them to.Â

title.children: Speaking about his mother's death helps Ty grieve, but people keep avoiding the topic

image.altText: Uniform and non-uniform police gathered in the middle of a road in central Geelong

props.synopsis: Police have set up a crime scene spanning hundreds of metres in the heart of Geelong as homicide detectives investigate the circumstances surrounding a fatal stabbing.

title.children: Man aged 20 dies after being stabbed in central Geelong

image.altText: Some soil in Darwin

props.synopsis: In the past 12 months, 80 people have contracted melioidosis in the Northern Territory, and five people have died. But researchers say a vaccine may not be far off.

title.children: As northern Australia braces for the wet season, researchers work to combat a deadly tropical disease

image.altText: Kate's Berry Farm exterior of buildings.

props.synopsis: After Kate Bradley "started life again" at age 43 in Tasmania, she decided to plant berries and sell ice cream. Thirty-five years on, after much success (and false starts), she looks back with pride â€” and is ready to move on from the business she built, much of it by her own hands.

title.children: After 'starting again' aged 43, Kate built her dream with her own hands

image.altText: an elderly man in a colourful shirt

props.synopsis: Amid wider concerns about aged care sector fees, there are calls for more transparency to be introduced to retirement villages across the ACT.

title.children: 'A black hole': Calls for Canberra's retirement villages to be more transparent

image.altText: Five women wearing black shirts and showing their arm muscles.

props.synopsis: At a working meat factory in Melbourne's south east, a group of women are part of an arm-wrestling club aptly named "The House of Pain".

title.children: Women smash stereotypes inside meat factory's arm-wrestling club

image.altText: McLaren's Oscar Piastri during qualifying, in his car, wheeled back into pits

props.synopsis: Australian Oscar Piastri has gone from fastest in Mexico City to out in the first part of qualifying.

title.children: Piastri goes from fastest in practice to out in Q1 at Mexico

image.altText: Graphic depicts author Han Kang looking serious in front of a historic photo of a tank

props.synopsis: The inspiration for the Korean author's book Human Acts stems from a devastating massacre in Gwangju over 40 years ago, but the ripple effects are still being felt today.

title.children: The real-life events behind Nobel Laureate Han Kang's haunting novel
